column5: Hi all,  I am going to find myself in Toronto next week with a bit of spare time throughout the week and am looking to do a bit of fishing.  Can anybody give me any idea's as to where is a descent river to fish for steelhead? Notice I said river and not 'your secret fishing hole."  A general area/body of water would be nice.  Thanks

Depending on how far you are willing to travel while in Toronto, the closest river would probably be the Humber, towards the west end. Haven't heard anything about it on the new board, there were some salmon reports on the old board I think.  There've been some reports on the Credit River, in Mississauga.  Lots of other tribs too -- Bowmanville, Oshawa, etc. but check the regs on where you can still fish.  Haven't been out myself so I can't give you any more advice than that.  Mike
yup humber is closest to ya, between old mill, and up to steeles i think is good...
Lol, im asking that same question, see Steelies at the T.Dot Islands.
Thanks for the help guys,  I'll either hit the Humber of the Credit river at some point this week.  Ill let you know how I got on.  Thanks again.
Went to the Islands a week ago. Got one pike on the Wards side but for the most part it was really slow...  FHR
